text: The testes, at an early period of foetal life, are placed at the back part of the abdominal cavity, behind the peritoneum, and each is attached by a peritoneal fold, the mesorchium, to the mesonephros. ==See also== * mesentery * mesovarium Mesorchium is the fibrous sheath which attaches vascular and avascular structures of spermatic cord together. ==References== ==External links== * - "Inguinal Region, Scrotum and Testes: Coverings of the Testis" * Category:Animal developmental biology
title: Mesorchium
